meanings.definition: To make or produce in advance
meanings.sent1: I will premake some sandwiches for our picnic tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She likes to premake her meals for the week on Sundays.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to premake all the desserts and surprise the guests.
meanings.sent4: The students were asked to premake their presentations to save time.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to premake the products to meet the high demand.

meanings.definition: Something made or produced in advance
meanings.sent1: The bakery offers premakes for customers who are in a hurry.
meanings.sent2: He bought a premake of the model airplane to save time on assembly.
meanings.sent3: The premake of the movie was leaked online before its official release.
meanings.sent4: The premake of the cake was a hit at the party.
meanings.sent5: She always keeps a premake of her favorite soup in the freezer for busy days.
